definition: just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: He would have gladly exchanged it all for a single word from Nadyezhda.
sentences.chinese: 他愿将所有这一切换得娜蒂契达的只言片语。

sentences.english: She had known nothing of the plan. Diego had never let on.
sentences.chinese: 她对这个计划一无所知，迭戈从未吐露只言片语。

definition: lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
lit. spider's thread and horse track/tiny hints (of a secret)/traces/clue
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
in a few words (idiom); expressed succinctly
between the words and the lines (idiom); implied meaning/connotations
